title: How do you say typography?
content:
A survey of sorts:   
   
What is the exact word or phrase in non-English languages for the word typography? I am seeking the exact translation in as many languages as possible.   
   
Thanks for your help in advance!
author: tamye

Well, in German, Typography can actually be writen one of many diffent ways. In his 1998 book, _Kurtstexte_, Kurt Weidemann writes the following about Typo and spelling (please forgive me, this is both a translation and a mental summary):   
   
_Tipografie_ would refer to any kind of typography that involves someone typing, i.e., a compositor at his keyboard, or a DTPer, but not an author with Microsoft Word (necessarially).   
   
_Typographie_ refers to the New Typography of the 1920s. Mostly because this is how Jan Tschichold spelled the word then.   
   
_Typografie_ is the "in" spelling of the word a the moment. It is also the correct spelling, according to _die neue deutsche Rechtschreibung_, I think. It implies the contemporary streamlinization of Typography, and is spelled just as it sounds (at least, that is what a German would tell you!).   
   
On an other note, I recently made a poster for an architecture company in Frankfurt, in which I wrote out Architecture in 11 different languages, including Turkish, Arabic, and Simplified Chinese. Unfortunately, in all of the European languages, the word _Architecture_ looks about the same. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20111225034011im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
